keyword: calories in an 8 ounce chicken breast
title: Calories in an 8 Ounce Chicken Breast
meta_description: Learn calories in an 8 ounce chicken breast, plus protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition facts, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
h1: Calories in an 8 Ounce Chicken Breast
assumptions: Skinless, boneless, cooked (grilled or roasted), no added oil or seasonings; 8 oz ≈ 227 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, cooking method, added ingredients, and exact weight; check labels or use a scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: An 8-ounce cooked skinless chicken breast provides about 375 kcal and 70 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil per 100 g during cooking
Breaded and fried (vs. grilled) per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories are in an 8 ounce chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 375 kcal for cooked, skinless boneless chicken breast.

faqs.q: How much protein in an 8 ounce chicken breast?
faqs.a: About 70 g of protein, making it a high-protein lean meat option.

faqs.q: Are these calories for raw or cooked chicken breast?
faqs.a: Cooked weight; raw 8 oz would be higher due to water loss during cooking.

faqs.q: Does adding marinade change calories in chicken breast?
faqs.a: Yes, sugary or oil-based marinades can add 20–50 kcal per 100 g.

faqs.q: What if the chicken breast has skin?
faqs.a: Skin adds about 45 kcal per 100 g, increasing total to around 477 kcal for 8 oz.
